arts.ttl: PLAYER RATINGS: How did Carlisle United fare against Newport?
arts.sum: RATINGS: Carlisle United fought back for a 3-2 victory over Newport County – so how did we score the players at Brunton Park?

arts.ttl: Carlisle United defender's season 'probably over' after injury
arts.sum: Archie Davies' season looks to be over after the defender injured his hamstring in Carlisle United's victory over Newport County.

arts.ttl: Carlisle United fight back to beat Newport thanks to Kelly and Hayden
arts.sum: United: Breeze, Davies (McArthur 24), Ellis, T Thomas, Hayden, Vela (Dennis 54), Whelan, Fusire (Bevan 80), Harris, Wearne (Hugill 80), Kelly. Carlisle, though, cut the deficit five minutes later when Callum Whelan fed Wearne, who in turn supplied Kelly to the left of goal and the striker turned it across Townsend and into the bottom corner.

arts.ttl: Aaron Hayden goal sees struggling Carlisle come from behind to beat Newport
Carlisle United v Newport County - as it happens!
arts.sum: Follow our live coverage as Carlisle United take on Newport County at Brunton Park in League Two today...

arts.ttl: The statement Carlisle United's owners SHOULD make
arts.sum: JON COLMAN: Firm words and reassuring actions must come soon from the top of Brunton Park amid the slide to relegation. Something like this...

arts.ttl: Hughes: Why I still believe Carlisle United can do it
arts.sum: Mark Hughes insists he still has “plenty” of belief Carlisle United can stay up – despite their gloomy position.

arts.ttl: Newport boss on the challenge and 'atmosphere' at Carlisle United
arts.sum: Newport County boss Nelson Jardim expects a “difficult game” and challenging atmosphere when his team faces rock-bottom Carlisle United.

arts.ttl: In pictures: Carlisle United fans at the Chesterfield game
arts.sum: GALLERY: Check out a selection of fan photos as 309 Carlisle United supporters backed the Blues at Chesterfield.

arts.ttl: Carlisle United boss: Embleton 'down' after red card incident
arts.sum: Head coach Mark Hughes says Elliot Embleton is “down” after the red card that further tarnished his struggling start to life with Carlisle United.
